body:
## Bevy version
0.14

## What you did
I tried to implement an observer with this basic system:
```rs
#[derive(Debug, Event)]
pub struct LocalPlayerSpawned(pub Entity);

fn attach_inputs(
    mut commands: Commands,
    trigger: Trigger<LocalPlayerSpawned>
) {
    // Describes how to convert from player inputs into those actions
    let input_map = InputMap::new([
        (Action::Jump, KeyCode::Space),
        (Action::Run, KeyCode::Enter)
    ]);

    commands.entity(trigger.entity())
        .insert(InputManagerBundle::with_map(input_map));
}
```

## What went wrong
It crashed:
```cli
error[E0277]: the trait bound `for<'a, 'b, 'c> fn(bevy::prelude::Commands<'a, 'b>, bevy::prelude::Trigger<'c, LocalPlayerSpawned>) {attach_inputs}: IntoObserverSystem<_, _, _>` is not satisfied
   --> client/src/input.rs:17:22
    |
17  |             .observe(attach_inputs)
    |              ------- ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `IntoSystem<bevy::prelude::Trigger<'static, _, _>, (), _>` is not implemented for fn item `for<'a, 'b, 'c> fn(bevy::prelude::Commands<'a, 'b>, bevy::prelude::Trigger<'c, LocalPlayerSpawned>) {attach_inputs}`, which is required by `for<'a, 'b, 'c> fn(bevy::prelude::Commands<'a, 'b>, bevy::prelude::Trigger<'c, LocalPlayerSpawned>) {attach_inputs}: IntoObserverSystem<_, _, _>`
    |              |
    |              required by a bound introduced by this call
    |
    = note: required for `for<'a, 'b, 'c> fn(bevy::prelude::Commands<'a, 'b>, bevy::prelude::Trigger<'c, LocalPlayerSpawned>) {attach_inputs}` to implement `IntoObserverSystem<_, _, _>`
note: required by a bound in `bevy::prelude::App::observe`
   --> /home/maz/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/bevy_app-0.14.0/src/app.rs:841:24
    |
839 |     pub fn observe<E: Event, B: Bundle, M>(
    |            ------- required by a bound in this associated function
840 |         &mut self,
841 |         observer: impl IntoObserverSystem<E, B, M>,
    |                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ required by this bound in `App::observe`
```
It was my first observer system so I wasn't aware that the Trigger should be the first parameter, other systems are less restrictive.

Alice said that we can make a custom diagnostic.

## Additional information

Discussed with @alice-i-cecile [in this discord thread](https://discord.com/channels/691052431525675048/1271128713496629289)
